com.sri.ai.util.cache

Interface CacheMap<K,V>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of the Map's keys.
    V - the type of the Map's values.
    All Superinterfaces:
    java.util.Map<K,V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCacheMap, FlexibleCacheMap

    @Beta
public interface CacheMap<K,V>
extends java.util.Map<K,V>
    Interface for maps working as a cache with garbage collection. Garbage collection is activated by providing an iterator going over objects that need to be kept in memory. The cache must eliminate references to all other objects. Optionally, the user can provide a NullaryFunction that evaluates to an iterator over reachable objects, and a period n between automatic garbage collections. Automatic garbage collection is then run with the iterator provided by the function, every n calls to the cache.
    Author:
    braz

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void garbageCollect(java.util.Iterator<K> reacheableObjectsIterator)
      Performs garbage collection by going over iterator range and considering these objects the ones that need to be kept, eliminating references for any other kept objects (which will then, if not referenced anywhere else, be garbage-collected by the Java virtual machine).

    • Method Detail

      • garbageCollect

        void garbageCollect(java.util.Iterator<K> reacheableObjectsIterator)
        Performs garbage collection by going over iterator range and considering these objects the ones that need to be kept, eliminating references for any other kept objects (which will then, if not referenced anywhere else, be garbage-collected by the Java virtual machine).
        Parameters:
        reacheableObjectsIterator - an iterator over reachable objects.

      • getGarbageCollectionPeriod

        int getGarbageCollectionPeriod()
        Returns the current number of calls to the cache made between one automatic garbage collection to the other. The automatic garbage collection is done by using the reachable objects iterator provided by getReachableObjectIteratorMaker() function. A value of -1 indicates that no automatic garbage collection takes place.
        Returns:
        the garbage collection period associated with the cache map.

      • setGarbageCollectionPeriod

        void setGarbageCollectionPeriod(int period)
        Allows the user to set the number of cache calls between automatic garbage collections. A value of -1 indicates that no automatic garbage collection takes place.
        Parameters:
        period - set the number of cache calls between number of automatic garbage collections, a value of -1 indicates that no automatic garbage collection.

      • getReachableObjectIteratorMaker

        NullaryFunction<java.util.Iterator<K>> getReachableObjectIteratorMaker()
        Returns the current reachable objects iterator maker. A null value indicates that no automatic garbage collection takes place.
        Returns:
        the factory method for creating a reachable objects iterator.

      • setReachableObjectIteratorMaker

        void setReachableObjectIteratorMaker(NullaryFunction<java.util.Iterator<K>> iteratorMaker)
        Allows the user to provide a new reachable objects iterator maker. A null value indicates that no automatic garbage collection takes place.
        Parameters:
        iteratorMaker - a factory method for creating a reachable object iterator. If null, not automatic garbage collection will take place.

      • stats

        com.google.common.cache.CacheStats stats()
        Returns:
        runtime statistics associated with the cache.
        See Also:
        Cache.stats()
